comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Emory Roy Buckner (1877-1941) was a noted attorney. An Iowa native and University of Nebraska alumnus, he graduated from Harvard Law School in 1907. Working at public agencies and private firms in New York City, he rapidly gained a reputation as one of the city's top trial lawyers. From 1925 to 1927 he served as US Attorney for the Southern District of New York, prosecuting a number of notable cases. This photo might date from 1912, when Buckner was named counsel of the Aldermanic committee then investigating police corruption in New York City. See this New York Times article of August 16, 1912.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I think I see 12/29/13 in reverse on the negative (top right). The NYT on that date, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9907EFD7113CE633A... suggests he was being considered for Police Commissioner.
